alert.note: Alert for Brown; Coleman; Kimble; Mason; McCulloch; Menard; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 12 at 3:42AM CDT until May 12 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Brown, Coleman, Kimble, Mason, McCulloch, Menard and San Saba. * WHEN...From this evening through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Expect heavy rainfall and possible flash flooding due to an upper level disturbance moving across, abundant low and mid level moisture and a cold front moving through. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible with locally higher amounts.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Coleman; Kimble; Mason; McCulloch; Menard; San Saba
